text: Yvonne Brathwaite Burke (born October 5, 1932) is a retired American politician. She was the first African-American woman to represent the West Coast in Congress. She served in congress from 1973 until the end of 1978. She was the Los Angeles County Supervisor representing the 2nd District (1992–2008). She was the Chair three times (1993–94, 1997–98, 2002–03). On December 1, 2008, she retired from the Board of Supervisors and was replaced by Mark Ridley-Thomas. On March 29, 2012, she was nominated by President Barack Obama to serve on the Amtrak Board of Directors. She retired in December 2024. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:Living people Category:United States representatives from California Category:Politicians from Los Angeles Category:Businesspeople from Los Angeles Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:African-American politicians
title: Yvonne Brathwaite Burke
